lines.text:
[to Catwoman]
Just the pussy I've been lookin' for!

[while being bombarded by food]
Why is there always someone who brings eggs and tomatoes to a speech?
[crouched atop a dazed Batman]
You're catnip to a girl like me. Handsome, dazed, and to die for.
Mistletoe can be deadly if you eat it.
But a kiss can be even deadlier if you mean it. You're the second man who killed me this week, but I've got seven lives left.
I tried to save you.
Seems like every woman you try to save ends up dead... or deeply resentful. Maybe you should retire.
Honey, I'm home. Oh, I forgot. I'm not married.
You poor guys. Always confusing your pistols with your privates.
A kiss under the mistletoe. You know, mistletoe can be deadly if you eat it.
But a kiss can be even deadlier... if you mean it.
[silence as they realize each other's identities]
Oh, my God. Does this mean we have to start fighting?
Let's go outside.
[Catwoman is hit]
How could you? I'm a woman.
I'm sorry, I-I...
[she hits him]
As I was saying, I'm a woman and can't be taken for granted. Life's a bitch, now so am I.
What do you want?
Ah, the direct approach. I admire that in a man with a mask.
[laughs, then turns serious]
You don't really think you'll win, do you?
Things change.
[Catwoman backflips into the middle of the confrontation. They stare at her, momentarily nonplussed]
Meow.
[a store explodes, she slips off]
I saw her first... gotta fly!
Somebody say fish? I haven't be fed all day!
Eat floor.
[throws Catwoman down]
High fiber.
Don't hurt us, lady. Our take-home's less than three-hundred.
You're overpaid. Hit the road.
[the Penguin creeps up behind Batman and grabs a trick umbrella - only to find it weaponless]
Ah, shit... I picked a cute one.
[hurls away the umbrella]
The heat's getting to me. I'll murder you momentarily. But first, I need a cold drink of ice water.
[he keels over on the edge of the bank. Six emperor penguins waddle up to the him and slide his body into the water]
Selina! Selina Kyle, you're fired! And Bruce Wayne, why are you dressed up like Batman?
Because he *is* Batman, you moron!
Was.
[shoots Batman]
We need to talk. You see, you and I have something in common.
Sounds familiar. Appetite for destruction? Contempt for the czars of fashion? Wait, don't tell me...
[begins to crawl onto the bed she's sitting on]
naked sexual charisma.
Batman. The thorn in both our sides. The fly in our ointment.
Ointment!
[jumps up and picks up two bottles]
Scented or unscented?
I'll come back later.
[Shreck shoots Batman]
You killed me... The Penguin killed me... Batman killed me... that's... three lives down. You got enough in there to finish me off?
One way to find out.
[Shreck fires two shots at Catwoman]
Four... Five...
[cracks her whip]
Still alive!
[Shreck fires two more]
Six... Seven... All good girls go to heaven...
[now within reach of Shreck; he pulls the trigger, but there are no bullets left; she laughs hysterically]
Two lives left. I think I'll save one for next Christmas. But in the meantime, how about a kiss, Santy Claus?
[grabs ahold of a power cable and moves towards Shreck with a stun gun and a kiss]

[hooking Catwoman onto his trick umbrella, which launches into the air]
Goodbye, my unintended; go to Heaven.

Here's what I want you to do... tell Selina - tell Miss Kyle in there - tell her, uh, tell her I had to go out of town, a big business deal came up or some... no, you know what? Tell her, you know, not in some dumb, "be my girlfriend" kind of way...
I will relay the message.
Great.
[runs out]
Miss Kyle...
Alfred, hi!
Mr. Wayne told me to tell you...

Mr. Wayne? Oh, Bruce. Yes. Um, would you tell him for me that, uh, I've been going through a lot of changes, and... no. Um, just that this is not a rejection, my abruptly leaving. In fact, he makes me feel the way I hope I really am... no! Could you just make up a sonnet or something? A dirty limerick?
One has just sprung to mind.
Thanks!
[runs out]
It's the so-called "normal" guys who always let you down. Sickos never scare me. Least they're committed.
It's gonna be a hot time on the cold town tonight.
You-you've got kind of a - kind of a dark side, don't you?
No darker than yours, Bruce.
Bruce... I would - I would love to live with you in your castle... forever, just like in a fairy tale.
[Batman caresses the back of her head]

[she claws Batman on the cheek]
I just couldn't live with myself, so don't pretend this is a happy ending!

[Selina walks Bruce to the elevator]
You don't seem like the type who does business with Mr. Shreck.
No, you don't seem like the type that takes orders from him.
Well, that's a... long story.
You know, I could... free up some time.
[Bruce walks in elevator]
I'm listed.
I'm tempted.
I'm working.

[Elevator doors close]
I'm leaving!
[addressing a huge flock of penguins]

My dear penguins, we stand on a great threshold! It's okay to be scared; many of you won't be coming back. Thanks to Batman, the time has come to punish *all* God's children! 1st, 2nd, 3rd *and* 4th-born! Why be biased? Male and female! Hell, the sexes are equal with their erogenous zones blown sky high! Forward march! The liberation of Gotham has begun!
Penguin... I mean, killing sleeping children. Isn't it that a little, uh...
[Penguin grabs an umbrella and shoots Henchman dead]
No! It's a lot "uh"!
[Kicks Henchman into the water]
I believe the word you're looking for is "Aaahh"!
[last lines]
Well, come what may. Merry Christmas, Mister Wayne.
Merry Christmas, Alfred. Good will toward men... and women.
By the way, how's Fred Atkins, your old partner?
Fred? Fred's actually... I believe he's on extended vacation. He's-he's good.
Good?
[Penguin takes out a severed hand]
Hi, Max! Remember me? I'm Fred's hand! You wanna greet any other body parts? Remember, Max. You flush it. I flaunt it.
Not a lot of reflective surfaces down in the sewer, huh?
[he chuckles and the Penguin joins in]
Still... could be worse. My nose could be gushing blood.
[they both laugh again]
Your nose could be... what do you mean by tha...
[the Penguin bites Josh's nose]
I am Catwoman. Hear me roar.
You gotta admit I played this stinkin' city like a harp from hell.

[to Catwoman]
You're Beauty and the Beast in one luscious Christmas gift pack.
Okay, go ahead. Intimidate me, bully me if it makes you feel big. I mean it's not like you can just kill me.
Actually, it's a lot like that.
Please. I wouldn't touch you to scratch you.
Our research tells us that voters like fingers.

[driving the Batmobile]
Maybe this is a bad time to mention this, but my license has expired!
It's chilly in here.
I'll warm you.
I don't know what you want, but I know I can get it for you, with a minimum of fuss! Money, jewels, a *very* big ball of string.
Your blood, Max.
My blood, I gave, at the office.
A half pint, I'm talking gallons.
Let's make a deal, other than my blood. What can I do for you?
Sorry, Max, a die for a die!
I'd like to fill her void.
Let's not forget about repairing the Batmobile. There's certain security to consider. It's not as though we can take it to any old "Joe's bodyshop," is it, sir?
Security? Who let Vicki Vale into the Batcave? I'm sitting there working and I turn around, there she is. "Oh hi, Vick - come on in."
Meow.
Wow, *the* Batman - or is it just "Batman"? Uh, your choice, of course!
[Batman walks away]
Well, that was very brief. Just like all the men in my life.
I don't know about you, Miss Kitty, but I feel so much yummier.
[the Ice Princess mistakes the batarang for a camera]
Say cheese!
Cheese!
[he throws it at her]
[the Organ Grinder's monkey approachs]
So where are all the children?
[the monkey hands him a note with a bat symbol on it]
"Dear Penguin. The children regret they are unable to attend - Batman."
[the Penguin screams]
How can you be so mean to someone so meaningless?
They wouldn't put me on a pedestal, so I'm layin' 'em on a slab!
Just relax. I'll take care of the squealing, wretched, pinhead puppets of Gotham!
You are the coolest role-model a young person could have!
And you're the hottest young person a role-model could have.
You didn't invite me, so I CRASHED!
Not even in office yet and already an enemies list, hmm?

Those names are not for prying eyes. Hey, why should I trust some cat-broad, anyway? Maybe you're just a screwed-up sorority chick who's gettin' back at her daddy for not buying her that pony when she turned sweet sixteen.

[falling into an open gravel filled truck]
Saved by kitty litter.

[notices Selina's injuries]
What happened?
Did you injure yourself on that ski slope? Is that why you cut short your vacation and came back?

You know, it's... a blur. I-I mean, not complete amnesia. I-I-I - I remember Sister Mary Margaret puking in church and Betsy Riley saying it was morning sickness and I remember the time I forgot to wear my underpants to school and the name of the boy who noticed was Ricky Friedberg.
[smile vanishes]
complete blur. Couldn't you just die?
I could really get into this mayor stuff. It's not about power, it's about reaching out to people - touching people - groping people!
Well, the party never stops on Selina Kyle's answering machine...

[to Catwoman]
You lousy minx! I oughta have you spayed!
[During the Mayor's speech, a Red Triangle Clown vaults on stage and grabs the Mayor's baby]
thanks.

[working on the Batcomputer. Alfred sets down a bowl of soup in front of him. He picks up the spoon and takes a sip, only to spit it out]
Cold!
It's vichyssoise.
[stares, not knowing why it's important]
It's *supposed* to be cold.
But when it comes down to it, who's holding the umbrella?

[to his penguins]
My babies. Did you miss me?
[he gets out of his wooden duck]
Did you miss me?
Great speech, Oswald.
[Penguin hits him]

[shouting]
My name is not Oswald! It's Penguin! I am not a human being. I am an animal! Cold-blooded!
Dad, you buy that "blurry" business?

Women. Nothing surprises me, Chip, except your late mother. Who'd have thought Selina had a brain to damage. Bottom line, she tries to blackmail me, I'll drop her out a higher window. Meantime, I got better fish to fry.
Check it out. We're gonna disassemble his Batmobile and turn it into an H-bomb on wheels.
No, no, he'd have even more power as a martyr. To destroy Batman, we must first turn him into what he hates the most. Namely us.
[plotting against Batman]
Batman napalmed my arm, he knocked me off a building just when I was starting to feel good about myself. I wanna play an integral part in his degradation.
A plan is forming.
I want in. The thought of busting Batman makes me feel all... dirty. Maybe I'll just give myself a bath right here.
[licks herself in a cat-like manner]
what's your angle?
Power surplus? Bruce, shame on you. No such thing. One can never have too much power. If my life has a meaning, that's the meaning.
Yeah, well... I'm gonna fight you on this. And I've already spoken to the mayor and we see eye to eye, so...
Mayors come and go. Blue bloods tire easy. You think you can go fifteen rounds with Muhammed Shreck?
Well, I guess we're gonna find out. Course, I don't have a crime boss like Cobblepot in my corner, so it might...
Crime boss? Shows what you know, Mr. to-the-manor-born-with-a-silver-spoon. Oswald is Gotham's new golden boy. If his parents hadn't eighty-sixed him, you two might've been bunkies at prep school!

[spinning an umbrella with hypnotic swirls painted on]
What you hide, I discover. What you put in your toilet, I place on my mantle. Get the picture?
What is that supposed to do? Hypnotize me?
No, just give you a splitting headache.
Well, it's not working.
[Penguin jerks the umbrella, which fires a shot, and Max jumps]
Ah, you big baby. Just blanks.
[the Circus Gang approaches the podium]
We want the big guy! The guy who runs the show!

[stepping forward]
What do you want?
Not you!
[the Clown backhands the Mayor]
Shreck!

[stepping forward]
You'll have to go through me!
[a dozen guns, knives, and swords are pointed into his face]
Ooooh!
You're coming with me, ya great white dope, to die way down in the sewer!
Not Chip! If you have an iota of human feeling, take me instead.
I don't, so no.
I'm the one you want. Ask yourself. Isn't it Max Shreck who manipulated and betrayed you, eh? Isn't it Max, not Chip, who you wanna see immersed up to his eyeballs in raw sewage?

[thinks]
Okay, you got a point. I'll let the little prince live.
I'd offer you a coffee, but my assistant is using her vacation time.
Good time, too. Everyone but the bandits will be slacking off till after New Year, anyway.
[first lines]
Merry Christmas!
Merry Christmas!
Burn baby, burn!
You said you were going to scare the Ice Princess.
She looked pretty scared to me!
Touring the riot scene. Gravely assessing the devastation. Upstanding mayor stuff.
You're not the mayor.
Things change.
You're just jealous, because I'm a genuine freak and you have to wear a mask!
You might be right.
[seeing Bruce Wayne in a tuxedo at a masquerade party]
Let me guess... trust fund goody-goody?
The tree lights up, and then I push the button. No-no, wait, wait, wait, wait. I press the button and *then* the tree lights up...
[the Batmobile is evading the police. Batman flips a switch on the control panel, and nothing happens]
That's funny.
[Flips switch again. Nothing happens]
Alright, NOW I'm a little worried.
[Slaps control panel; Batmobile morphs into the Batmissile]
Thanks for the saving the day, Batman. I'm afraid the circus gang is back.
We'll see.

[to a crowd of voters]
I may have saved the mayor's baby, but I refuse to save a mayor who stood by helpless *as a baby*, while Gotham City was ravaged by a disease that turned eagle scouts into crazed clowns and happy homemakers into catwomen!
Rats with wings do your thing.

Actually, this is all just a bad dream. You're at home, in bed, heavily sedated, resting comfortably, dying from the carcinogens you personally spewed in a lifetime of profiteering. Tragic irony or poetic justice, you tell me.
Why are you still out? Are you concerned about that strange, heroic Penguin person?
I think he knows who his parents are. There's something else.
You know what, I mistook me for somebody else.

[on the Batmobile's TV screen]
Don't adjust your sets. Welcome to the Oswald Cobblepot school of driving. Gentlemen, start your screaming!
Why are you now determined to prove that this Penguin is not what he seems? Must you be the only lonely man-beast in town?
So he survived. What's the worry?
He didn't even lose a limb! An eyeball! Bladder control!
I wish I could hand out World Peace and Unconditional Love, wrapped in a big bow.

[Watching from behind the sewer grill]
Oh, but you can! Oh, but you will!
Sir, shall we change the channel to a program with some dignity and class? The Love Connection, perhaps?

[reading news archives on the Red Triangle Circus]
"Red Triangle Circus put on a swell show with fierce lions... circus returns with a Freak Show, may not be suitable for kids. Featuring a poodle lady, the world's fattest man... and an aquatic bird boy."
Why are you so determined to prove this Penguin is not what he seems? Must you be the only lonely man-beast in town?

[continues reading]
"... circus folded its tents yesterday, perhaps forever after numerous reports of missing children. In several towns, police have closed down the Red Triangle's fairgrounds, however at least one freak show performer vanished before he could be questioned."
I suppose you feel better now, sir.
No, actually I feel worse.
True. I was their number one son, and they treated me like number two.
